snippet: Philadelphia agreed on Monday to sell its natural gas utility to UIL Holdings, a publicly traded power company, for about $1.9 billion, in a deal that would put the country’s biggest city-owned gas works in private hands.
abstract: Philadelphia agreed on Monday to sell its natural gas utility to UIL Holdings, a publicly traded power company, for about $1.9 billion, in a deal that would put the country’s biggest city-owned gas works in private hands.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Philadelphia to Sell Its Gas Works Utility for $1.9 Billion
